Comment.Language: If the woman gives birth to a boy, she comes to the priest after forty days. If it was a girl, then she comes after eighty days.

Text.Language: O Lord, God, the Pantocrator, the Father of our Lord, God, and Savior Jesus Christ; the Treasure of light, the Creator, the Chaser away of all diseases, who reconciles all to the repentance of harmony;

P[oic Vnou] Pipantokratwr Viwt m~Pen[oic ouoh Pennou] ouoh Pencwt/r I/couc Pi,~rictoc: p~yucauroc n~te piouwini Pid/miorgoc Pidiwgmoc/ n~te niswni t/rou efhwtp m~pie~p~t/rf eumetanoia n~te oucumvwnia.

who have adorned all by the law of His love, through the Economy of His Logos, the only-begotten Son, when He came to us in the flesh through the holy Theotokos and ever-virgin, Saint Mary,

V/e~tafcolcel m~pie~p~t/rf qen v~nomoc n~te tefa~gap/: hiten ]oikonomia n~te Peflogoc m~monogen/c Ps/ri e~tafi~ saron qen t~carx: e~bol qen ]yeo~tokoc eyouab: ouoh m~paryenoc n~c/ou niben ]a~gia Maria.

and the Holy Spirit, the Healer and Physician of our nature, our Teacher of Your true knowledge, that we may be saved through the preaching of Your Holy Gospel.
Nem Pip~neuma eyouab n~reftal[o ouoh n~c/ini n~te tenvucic: n~ref]c~bw nan e~qoun e~peke~mi m~m/i eyrenoujai e~bol hiten pihiwis n~te nekeuaggelion eyouab.

For the sake of man whom You have created and the act of the woman whom You have brought out of him, to be a helper to him, after the economy of canonical marriage, You have blessed the fruit of the lawful offspring of the similitude of Your image and Your likeness.

Eybe pirwmi e~takyamiof nem p~hwb n~]c~himi e~takenc e~bol n~q/tf e~oubo/~yoc naf kata ouoikonomia n~gamoc p~kanwnikon: akc~mou e~pikarpoc n~te pijinmici n~nomimon n~te pihucwn n~te tekhukwn nem peki~ni.

And have enlarged the bounds of our nature by a succession of seed, unto the furnishing of the world and all that are therein, through all Your saints and the seed of the kingdom of the heavens.
Ouoh nenhoroc n~]vucic aky~rouerenergin kata oudiado,/ n~te ouj~roj oukocm/cic m~pikocmoc n~te n/etw~op n~q/tf t/rou: hiten n/eyouab t/rou n~tak: nem p~j~roj n~te y~metouro n~niv/oui.

Therefore, O Lord, You have purified our nature and have delivered us through an inward personal reconciliation in mystical and real fellowship.
Eybe vai P[oic aktoubo n~tenvucic akaiten n~remhe e~bol hiten pijinhwtn e~qoun: kata ouhupoctacic qen t~koinwnia m~muctik/ n~p~rakton.
Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø¬Ù„Ù? Ù‡Ø°Ø§ ÙŠØ§Ø±Ø¨ Ø·Ù‡Ø±ØªÙŽ Ø·Ø¨ÙŠØ¹ØªÙŽÙ†Ø§ ÙˆØ¹ÙŽØªÙŽÙ‚ØªÙŽÙ†Ø§ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¥ØªØ­Ø§Ø¯Ù? Ù?ÙŠ Ø´Ø®ØµÙ?ÙƒÙŽ Ù?ÙŠ Ø´Ø±ÙƒØ©Ù? Ø³Ø±ÙŠØ©Ù?.
We ask and entreat You, O Lover of Mankind, to look upon Your handmaid (...); may Your Holy Spirit be renewed in her inward parts; purify her from her impurities.
Ten]ho ouoh tentwbh m~mok Pimairwmi hopwc n~tekjoust e~jen tekbwki )nim): mare Pekp~neuma eyouab erberi qen n/etcaqoun m~moc: matouboc e~bol ha necywleb.

May she be renewed in her soul and her body and her spirit; and absolve her from all accusations, and all her old acts, unto a pardoning of all her trespasses.

Comment.Language: Then the priest anoints the woman with oil. After the baptism she enters the church and partakes of the holy Mysteries.
